Local content policies should aim to achieve a balance between protectionism and nurturing competitiveness so that growing national sectors and industries benefit from major investments, transfers of technology and know-how. This topic overview discusses the requirements, constraints, and risks associated with developing local content policies and legislation. It highlights the key points in the oil and gas, and mining lifecycle where local content can be most effective, and provides a road map identifying key steps to developing local content policies.

The extractive industries have the potential to deliver economic development that can transform the lives of citizens in resource rich countries. However, when we talk about development gains for these citizens, it is important to look at the different needs and experiences of women and men

The extractives sector has the potential to contribute to the development of an economy in ways other than by direct contribution from its revenue stream. Through the creation of linkages to other sectors of the economy, extractives sector operations can create employment, play a significant role in poverty reduction and reduce aid dependency. There are various forms that linkages could take to generate these benefits. This topic overview investigates some of the ways that oil, gas and mining investments can open up opportunities in other sectors and address the challenges of sustaining linkage initiatives.

This topic material examines the key determinants of investment and the factors that need to be considered in formulating an effective investment promotion strategy in the extractives sector. It suggests tools which can be used by governments and investors in seeking to maximise their extractives sector and provides an overview of some of the fundamental elements for preparing an investment friendly framework to achieve sustainable economic development from the efficient extraction of petroleum and mineral wealth.
